original_text: Shout for help, if you like. See if your group of idols can help you! The wind will blow them all away. Even a breath will carry them away. But if people trust me to help them, this land will belong to them. They will worship me on my holy mountain.’ 57: ‘my holy mountain’ means Mount Zion in Jerusalem, where Solomon built God's temple. The Lord promises to help his people Shout for help, if you like.
korean_text: 네가 부르짖을 때에 네가 모은 우상들에게 너를 구원하게 하라 그것들은 다 바람에 날려 가겠고 기운에 불려갈 것이로되 나를 의뢰하는 자는 땅을 차지하겠고 나의 거룩한 산을 기업으로 얻으리라

sentences.original_text: Shout for help, if you like.
See if your group of idols can help you!
sentences.korean_translation: 네 우상들이 너를 도울 수 있는지 보아라!

sentences.original_text: The wind will blow them all away.
Even a breath will carry them away.
sentences.korean_translation: 심지어 숨결 하나도 그들을 날려버릴 것이다.

sentences.original_text: But if people trust me to help them,
sentences.korean_translation: 하지만 사람들이 내가 도울 것을 신뢰한다면,

sentences.original_text: this land will belong to them.
sentences.korean_translation: 이 땅은 그들의 것이 될 것이다.

sentences.original_text: They will worship me on my holy mountain.'
sentences.korean_translation: 그들은 나의 거룩한 산에서 나를 경배할 것이다.'

sentences.original_text: 57: 'my holy mountain' means Mount Zion in Jerusalem,
sentences.korean_translation: 57: '나의 거룩한 산'은 예루살렘의 시온 산을 의미하며,

sentences.original_text: The Lord promises to help his people
Shout for help, if you like.
